Melissa Huckaby cries at hearing over girl in suitcase murder and rape trial
 By staff writers
 NEWS.com.au
 April 16, 2009 09:29am
 
 
 
 ... Melissa Huckaby appears in court accused of raping and murdering a girl / AP 
 Woman appears in court over girl's murder 
 Victim was allegedly raped with foreign object 
 Body found in suitcase dumped in pond
 A SUNDAY school teacher accused of raping and murdering a girl and leaving the body in a suitcase has cried during her first court appearance.
 
 In a red jumpsuit and shackles Melissa Huckaby, 28, trembled and cried as the judge read out the charges against her in a San Joaquin County courtroom in California, Associated Press reports.
 
 Ms Huckaby has been charged with murdering eight-year-old Sandra Cantu, whose body was found in a suitcase pulled from a pond.
 
 Family members of Ms Huckaby and Sandra were also in attendance at the hearing and some were observed softly crying during proceedings.
 
 Prosecutors have included an extra charge against Ms Huckaby the special circumstances of rape with a foreign object, lewd and lascivious conduct with a child and murder in the course of a kidnapping, AP reported. 
 
 
 Ms Huckaby was a volunteer Sunday school teacher at her grandfather's Clover Road Baptist Church and lived in the mobile home park in the northern California town of Tracy where Sandra also lived, AP reported. 
 
 
 Security camera video footage of the girl showed her skipping through her neighbourhood shortly before her disappearance. 
 
 The suitcase containing her body - which Ms Huckaby claimed had been stolen from her - was recovered from an irrigation pond on April 6. 
 
 Ms Huckaby had previously told the local media that her five-year-old daughter had been playing with Sandra on the day of her disappearance.

 I am also rabidly pro-choice until the point a fetus reaches a point of viability outside the womb. The issues of rights for the fetus begins to arise.

Actually, I appreciate your statement. Why do you, personally, oppose late-term abortions?
 

 
 People can make mistakes. Maybe a person gets pregnant and doesn't realize it. Then when human life, is merely a clump of cells and the mother cannot really be faulted beyond a reasonable doubt, then it is fair enough to have an abortion.
 
 However, once it becomes obvious to a mother that she's pregnant and she's waited months for the fetus to develop, then she's at fault for negligence. Allowing the life to grow inside of her basically on a whim, treating life with no respect. At that point, there is no reason to sympathize with her negligence and the fetus has grown to a point where it is far more than a clump of cells and resembles a human being. As you say, in many cases in can survive outside of the womb. 
 
 My preference is to set the cut off date at around 3 months from inception. That would be my deadline to get an abortion. I would rather see late term abortion completely banned.
